Action: Upload a file which is not XML
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area" /publisher/uploadfile
Select "Choose file" and select a file from your computer which is not text based (e.g. an image file or a PDF)
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating an error has occurred
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes". Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: Upload an XML file which does not meet the DOAJ schema
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"

Select "Choose file" and select a file from your computer which is XML but not of the DOAJ schema. You may use the file "schema_invalid.xml" from the DOAJ folder in resources for this test.

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/schema_invalid.xml
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating an error has occurred
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes" (you may need to reload the page). Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: Upload a malformed XML file
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"

Select "Choose file" and select a file from your computer which looks like XML but is actually malformed.  You may use the file "not_xml.xml" from the DOAJ folder in resources for this test.

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/not_xml.xml
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating an error has occurred
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: Upload a file with duplicates inside the file
Ensure that the publisher account owns a journal with Print ISSN "1111-1111" and E-ISSN "2222-2222", and these are not attached to any other journals
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "duplicate_in_file.xml" from the DOAJ folder

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/duplicate_in_file.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen: File uploaded and waiting to be processed. Check back here for updates.
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: Upload a file containing ISSNs the publisher does not own

Ensure that the ISSNs 0000-0002 and 0000-000X are in DOAJ attached to one or more journals (e.g. one with 0000-000X AND 0000-0002 or two, one with 0000-0002 and another with 0000-000X).  None of the journals with these ISSNs should be owned by the publisher
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "unowned_issn.xml" from the DOAJ folder

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/unowned_issn.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating a successful upload: File uploaded and waiting to be processed. Check back here for updates.(Dismiss)
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: click on "(show error details)" for the record in the "History of uploads"
Expected Test Results: * Additional error details are shown, indicating that the publisher does not own ISSNs "0000-0000" and "0000-000X"

Action: Upload a file containing ISSN that has been withdrawn
Ensure that the publisher owns a journal with ISSN 0000-0000 that is not in DOAJ (ie. has been withdrawn)
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "withdrawn_journal.xml" from the DOAJ folder

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/withdrawn_journal.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating a successful upload: File uploaded and waiting to be processed. Check back here for updates.(Dismiss)
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: click on "(show error details)" for the record in the "History of uploads"
Expected Test Results: * Additional error details are shown, indicating that the journal has been withdrawn from DOAJ and therefore the article cannot be accepted

Action: Upload a file containing ISSNs not previously seen in DOAJ
Ensure that the ISSN "1111-1111" is attached to a journal owned by the publisher and ISSN "5555-5555" is not present in any journal in DOAJ.
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "unmatched_issn.xml"  from the DOAJ folder

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/unmatched_issn.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating a successful upload: File uploaded and waiting to be processed. Check back here for updates.(Dismiss)
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: click on "(show error details)" for the record in the "History of uploads"
Expected Test Results: * Additional error details are shown, indicating that the ISSN "5555-5555" does not appear in DOAJ.

Action: Upload a file containing ISSNs erroneously shared with another account
Ensure that the ISSN "1111-1111" is attached a journal owned by the publisher and ISSN "2222-2222" is attached to the same journal and also to another journal not owned by the publisher
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "shared_issn.xml"  from the DOAJ folder

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/shared_issn.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating a successful upload: File uploaded and waiting to be processed. Check back here for updates.(Dismiss)
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: click on "(show error details)" for the record in the "History of uploads"
Expected Test Results: * Additional error details are shown, indicating that the ISSN "2222-2222" is shared with another user

Action: Successfully upload a file containing a new article

Ensure that the publisher account owns a journal with Print ISSN "1111-1111" and E-ISSN "2222-2222", and these are not attached to any other journals and that these journal does not contain "Success" or "Update" articles from previous tests.
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "successful.xml"  from the DOAJ folder

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/successful.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating a successful upload File uploaded and waiting to be processed. Check back here for updates.(Dismiss)
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "successfully processed", and the Note "1 articles imported (1 new, 0 updated)"

Action: Go to the Table of Contents for the journal (e.g. by going to /toc/2222-2222)
Expected Test Results: * The list of articles should contain an article with the title "Success!"

Action: Successfully upload a file containing an updated article
Run through test 7 to upload a new article
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"
Choose "DOAJ Native XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "update.xml" from the DOAJ folder

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/update.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating a successful upload File uploaded and waiting to be processed. Check back here for updates.(Dismiss)
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "successfully processed", and the Note "1 articles imported (0 new, 1 updated)"

Action: Go to the Table of Contents for the journal (e.g. by going to /toc/2222-2222)
Expected Test Results: * The list of articles should contain an article with the title "Updated!", and the previous version ("Success!") should be gone

Action: Successfully upload a file by reference containing a new or updated article
Run through test 7 and 8 to upload and update a new article
Make sure there are no other articles in the databse with the DOI: 10.1234/100. Delete those first.
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"

In the box "Provide a URL where we can download the XML", enter the URL below

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/successful.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating that the file reference was successfully received
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

Action: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data).  If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.
Expected Test Results: * Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "successfully processed", and the Note "1 articles imported (1 new, 0 updated)" or "1 articles imported (0 new, 1 updated)".

Action: Go to the Table of Contents for the journal (e.g. by going to /toc/2222-2222)
Expected Test Results: * The list of articles should contain an article with the title "Success!"

Action: Upload a file containing author's ORCID iD in a wrong format
Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"

Select "Choose file" and select the test resource file "orcid_id_invalid.xml"

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/feature/2546_author_retains_copyright_facet/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/DOAJ/orcid_id_invalid.xml
Click "Upload"
Expected Test Results:
* A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating an error has occurred
* Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a "Unable to validate document with identified schema" entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

Action: click on "(show error details)" for the record in the "History of uploads"
Expected Test Results: * Additional error details are shown, indicating that the ORCID iD is not in the correct format
